at0000.1.1.description: *Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.(en)
at0000.1.1.comment: *This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.(en)

at0000.1.description: *Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.(en)
at0000.1.comment: *This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.(en)

at0109.1.description: *The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.(en)

at0013.1.description: *The scheduled medication course has been postponed prior to any administration.(en)

at0012.1.description: *The planned course of medication has been cancelled prior to any administration.(en)

at0016.1.description: *The time to start this medication, or other starting condition, has been set.(en)

at0153.1.description: *The medication has been formally authorised for use.(en)

at0148.1.description: *The medication has been physically prepared. For example: preparation of an intravenous mixture.(en)

at0005.1.description: *The specific medication item has been reviewed, as planned. This is not intended to capture review of the whole medication list.(en)

at0004.1.description: *The medication has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time. Although in some settings this significant date may be computable as the first of several administrations, in other settings, such as primary care, specific administration dates are not readily available.(en)

at0008.1.description: *The prescription has not been dispensed due to a technical or pharamaceutical supply issue.(en)

at0015.1.description: *The administration of this medication has been ceased after the first dose has been administered, but before intended completion of the course.  (en)

at0007.1.description: *The medication course has been completed as planned.(en)

at0020.1.description: *Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item which was the focus of the activity.(en)
at0020.1.comment:
*For example: 'Atenolol 100mg' or 'Tenormin tablets 100mg'. 
It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' is coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.(en)

at0025.1.description: *The sequence number specific to the activity being recorded.(en)

at0006.1.description: *A single administration of the medication has taken place.(en)

at0018.1.description: *The administration of a medication has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.(en)

at0044.1.description: *Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.(en)

at0000.description: *Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.(en)
at0000.comment: *This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.(en)

at0002.description: *A prescription has been issued for the medication.(en)

at0003.description: *The ordered medication has been dispensed, for example from a pharmacy to the patient.(en)

at0004.description: *The medication has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time. Although in some settings this significant date may be computable as the first of several administrations, in other settings, such as primary care, specific administration dates are not readily available.(en)

at0005.description: *The specific medication item has been reviewed, as planned. This is not intended to capture review of the whole medication list.(en)

at0006.description: *A single administration of the medication has taken place.(en)

at0007.description: *The medication course has been completed as planned.(en)

at0008.description: *The prescription has not been dispensed due to a technical or pharamaceutical supply issue.(en)

at0009.description: *The administration of the medication has been suspended until further notice. No further doses should be given until the restart date or conditions have been met. When setting the date/conditions for restart after suspending, a step from Administrations suspended and back to 'Medication start date/condition set' should be performed.(en)

at0010.description: *A prescription token has been re-issued for an existing medication order.(en)

at0011.description: *Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.(en)

at0012.description: *The planned course of medication has been cancelled prior to any administration.(en)

at0013.description: *The scheduled medication course has been postponed prior to any administration.(en)

at0015.description: *The administration of this medication has been ceased after the first dose has been administered, but before intended completion of the course.  (en)

at0016.description: *The time to start this medication, or other starting condition, has been set.(en)

at0018.description: *The administration of a medication has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.(en)

at0020.description: *Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item which was the focus of the activity.(en)
at0020.comment:
*For example: 'Atenolol 100mg' or 'Tenormin tablets 100mg'. 
It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' is coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.(en)

at0021.description: *Reason that the pathway step for the identified medication was carried out.(en)
at0021.comment: *For example: 'Postponed - Patient not avalable at administration time', 'Cancelled - Adverse reaction'. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.(en)

at0024.description: *Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields, including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.(en)
at0024.comment: *For example: 'Patient was in radiology department', 'Accidental injection into blood vessel during IM administration'.(en)

at0025.description: *The sequence number specific to the activity being recorded.(en)

at0033.description: *Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.(en)
at0033.comment: *For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.(en)

at0039.description: *A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.(en)

at0041.description: *The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.(en)

at0043.description: *The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.(en)
at0043.comment: *Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)

at0044.description: *Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.(en)

at0053.description: *Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.(en)

at0103.comment: *Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.(en)

at0104.description: *Structured details about the medication including strength, form and constituent substances.(en)
at0104.comment: *Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the dispensed, authorised or administered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.(en)

at0106.description: *The original medication order has been re-authorised to allow repeat prescription or dispensing. In some jurisdictions an entirely new order must be issued in these circumstances.(en)

at0109.description: *The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.(en)

at0131.description: *Specific details about the amount of the medication item.(en)
at0131.comment: *Dosage_administration is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.(en)

at0132.description: *Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.(en)
at0132.comment: *In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.(en)

at0133.description: *The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.(en)
at0133.comment: *For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate(en)

at0138.description: *A medication was substituted which is bioequivalent to that ordered.(en)

at0139.description: *Although allowed by the medication order a bioequvalent medication was not substituted.(en)

at0140.description: *Details of body site and administration of the medication.(en)

at0141.description: *Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.(en)
at0141.comment:
*For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. 
Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0142.description: *Structured description of the site of administration of the medication, vaccine or therapeutic good.(en)
at0142.comment: *For example: "On the medial skin surface of the left forearm, from 10 cm to 20 cm distally from the point of the elbow".(en)

at0143.description: *The technique or device by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered.(en)
at0143.comment: *Comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0144.description: *Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the medication.(en)

at0145.description: *Draft prescription has been prepared and is awaiting confirmation from an authorised clinician. May be used where reauthorisations are performed as a batch. This careflow_step may have a status of 'planned' or 'active', reflecting the need to to handle new orders as well as re-authorised orders.(en)

at0147.description: *The route by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered into the subject's body.(en)
at0147.comment: *Comment: For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'. Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.(en)

at0148.description: *The medication has been physically prepared. For example: preparation of an intravenous mixture.(en)

at0149.description: *The action step has been checked by a separate individual.(en)
at0149.comment: *Details of the individual performing the double-check can be carried in the Reference Model element "Participation".(en)

at0150.description: *The prescription was cancelled prior to being issued.(en)

at0151.description: *Prescription has been invalidated or has expired without being fulfilled.(en)

at0153.description: *The medication has been formally authorised for use.(en)

at0154.description: *The date/time on which the medication course is set to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)

at0155.description: *The criterion which triggers the medication course to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)

at0044.1.description: *Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.(en)

at0000.description: *Any activity related to the planning, scheduling, prescription management, dispensing, administration, cessation and other use of a medication, vaccine, nutritional product or other therapeutic item.(en)
at0000.comment: *This is not limited to activities performed based on medication orders from clinicians, but could also include for example taking over the counter medication.(en)

at0002.description: *A prescription has been issued for the medication.(en)

at0003.description: *The ordered medication has been dispensed, for example from a pharmacy to the patient.(en)

at0004.description: *The medication has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time. Although in some settings this significant date may be computable as the first of several administrations, in other settings, such as primary care, specific administration dates are not readily available.(en)

at0005.description: *The specific medication item has been reviewed, as planned. This is not intended to capture review of the whole medication list.(en)

at0006.description: *A single administration of the medication has taken place.(en)

at0007.description: *The medication course has been completed as planned.(en)

at0008.description: *The prescription has not been dispensed due to a technical or pharamaceutical supply issue.(en)

at0009.description: *The administration of the medication has been suspended until further notice. No further doses should be given until the restart date or conditions have been met. When setting the date/conditions for restart after suspending, a step from Administrations suspended and back to 'Medication start date/condition set' should be performed.(en)

at0010.description: *A prescription token has been re-issued for an existing medication order.(en)

at0011.description: *Reissuing of this prescription is not available without some intervention.(en)

at0012.description: *The planned course of medication has been cancelled prior to any administration.(en)

at0013.description: *The scheduled medication course has been postponed prior to any administration.(en)

at0015.description: *The administration of this medication has been ceased after the first dose has been administered, but before intended completion of the course.  (en)

at0016.description: *The time to start this medication, or other starting condition, has been set.(en)

at0018.description: *The administration of a medication has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.(en)

at0020.description: *Name of the medication, vaccine or other therapeutic/prescribable item which was the focus of the activity.(en)
at0020.comment:
*For example: 'Atenolol 100mg' or 'Tenormin tablets 100mg'. 
It is strongly recommended that the 'Medication item' is coded with a terminology capable of triggering decision support, where possible. The extent of coding may vary from the simple name of the medication item through to structured details about the actual medication pack used. Free text entry should only be used if there is no appropriate terminology available.(en)

at0021.description: *Reason that the pathway step for the identified medication was carried out.(en)
at0021.comment: *For example: 'Postponed - Patient not avalable at administration time', 'Cancelled - Adverse reaction'. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.(en)

at0024.description: *Additional narrative about the activity or care pathway step not captured in other fields, including details of any variance between the intended action and the action actually performed.(en)
at0024.comment: *For example: 'Patient was in radiology department', 'Accidental injection into blood vessel during IM administration'.(en)

at0025.description: *The sequence number specific to the activity being recorded.(en)

at0033.description: *Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.(en)
at0033.comment: *For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.(en)

at0039.description: *A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.(en)

at0041.description: *The medication order has been changed in a manner which does not require a new instruction/order to be issued, according to local clinical rules.(en)

at0043.description: *The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.(en)
at0043.comment: *Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.(en)

at0044.description: *Administration of a dose of mediciation has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.(en)

at0053.description: *Further structured details of the action, possibly specific to a pathway step.(en)

at0103.comment: *Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.(en)

at0104.description: *Structured details about the medication including strength, form and constituent substances.(en)
at0104.comment: *Use this SLOT where the detailed description of the dispensed, authorised or administered item needs to be explicitly stated. For example: the form, strength, any diluents or mixture of ingredients.(en)

at0106.description: *The original medication order has been re-authorised to allow repeat prescription or dispensing. In some jurisdictions an entirely new order must be issued in these circumstances.(en)

at0109.description: *The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.(en)

at0131.description: *Specific details about the amount of the medication item.(en)
at0131.comment: *Dosage_administration is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.(en)

at0132.description: *Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.(en)
at0132.comment: *In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.(en)

at0133.description: *The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.(en)
at0133.comment: *For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate(en)

at0138.description: *A medication was substituted which is bioequivalent to that ordered.(en)

at0139.description: *Although allowed by the medication order a bioequvalent medication was not substituted.(en)

at0140.description: *Details of body site and administration of the medication.(en)

at0141.description: *Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.(en)
at0141.comment:
*For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. 
Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0142.description: *Structured description of the site of administration of the medication, vaccine or therapeutic good.(en)
at0142.comment: *For example: "On the medial skin surface of the left forearm, from 10 cm to 20 cm distally from the point of the elbow".(en)

at0143.description: *The technique or device by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered.(en)
at0143.comment: *Comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)

at0144.description: *Details of the medical device used to assist administration of the medication.(en)

at0145.description: *Draft prescription has been prepared and is awaiting confirmation from an authorised clinician. May be used where reauthorisations are performed as a batch. This careflow_step may have a status of 'planned' or 'active', reflecting the need to to handle new orders as well as re-authorised orders.(en)

at0147.description: *The route by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered into the subject's body.(en)
at0147.comment: *Comment: For example: 'oral', 'intravenous', or 'topical'. Coding of the route with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Multiple potential routes may be specified.(en)

at0148.description: *The medication has been physically prepared. For example: preparation of an intravenous mixture.(en)

at0149.description: *The action step has been checked by a separate individual.(en)
at0149.comment: *Details of the individual performing the double-check can be carried in the Reference Model element "Participation".(en)

at0150.description: *The prescription was cancelled prior to being issued.(en)

at0151.description: *Prescription has been invalidated or has expired without being fulfilled.(en)

at0153.description: *The medication has been formally authorised for use.(en)

at0154.description: *The date/time on which the medication course is set to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)

at0155.description: *The criterion which triggers the medication course to restart, as per the "Medication restart date/condition set" pathway step.(en)

at0109.1.1.description: *The medication has been recommended but no steps have been taken to initiate prescribing.(en)

at0.2.1.comment: e.g. First primary immunisation, MMR booster, Second Covid-19 vaccination.

at0.4.1.description: The diseases targeted by the vaccine.

at0103.0.1.description: Unique identifier for the medication order.
at0103.0.1.comment: Comment: This data element allows for multiple occurrences to be defined more explicitly at run-time, if required.

at0044.1.1.description: An administration of a dose of the medication has been delayed but is expected to be given as soon as possible.

at0009.0.1.description: The administration of the medication has been suspended until further notice. No further doses should be given until the restart date or conditions have been met. When setting the date/conditions for restart after suspending, a step from Administrations suspended and back to 'Medication start date/condition set' should be performed.

at0154.0.1.description: The date/time on which the medication course is set to restart, as per the "Administrations suspended" pathway step.

at0013.1.1.description: The scheduled medication course has been postponed prior to any administration.

at0018.1.1.description: An administration of the medication has been withheld and not given. There is no expectation that it will be given later, though the next dose (if any) should be administered according to the original order.

at0021.0.1.description: Reason that the pathway step for the identified medication was carried out.
at0021.0.1.comment: For example: 'Postponed - Patient not avalable at administration time', 'Cancelled - Adverse reaction'. Note: This is not the reason for the medication instruction, but rather the specific reason that a care step was carried out, and will often be used to document some variance from the original order.

at0132.0.1.description: Subsitution action taken by the person administering or dispensing the drug.
at0132.0.1.comment: In many jurisdictions, substitution of an ordered item as a generic form or with a different brand name, which has been determined as bioequivalent, is allowed at the point of dispense or supply. In other cases substitution is assumed and the clinician has to explicitly request non-substitution.

at0145.0.1.description: Draft prescription has been prepared and is awaiting confirmation from an authorised clinician. May be used where reauthorisations are performed as a batch. This careflow_step may have a status of 'planned' or 'active', reflecting the need to to handle new orders as well as re-authorised orders.

at0153.1.1.description: The medication has been formally authorised for use.

at0025.1.1.description: The sequence number specific to the pathway step being recorded.

at0012.1.1.description: The planned course of medication has been cancelled prior to any administration.

at0148.1.1.description: The medication has been physically prepared. For example: preparation of an intravenous mixture.

at0143.0.1.description: The technique or device by which the ordered item was, or is to be, administered.
at0143.0.1.comment: Comment: For example: ' via Z-track injection'; 'via nebuliser'. Coding of the method with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0131.0.1.description: Specific details about the amount of the medication item.
at0131.0.1.comment: CLUSTER.dosage is intended to carry details of medication order changes or dose administrations, whilst CLUSTER.medication_supply_amount is intended for details of dispensing-related activity.

at0003.0.1.description: The ordered medication has been dispensed, for example from a pharmacy to the patient.

at0033.0.1.description: Any guidance, instructions or advice given to the subject of care or personal carer at the time of the pathway step.
at0033.0.1.comment: For example: 'Avoid grapefruit' , 'Take at least 2 hours before bedtime', 'Take with food'. May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate.

at0007.1.1.description: The medication course has been completed as planned.

at0.7.1.description: The total number of administrations expected.

at0002.0.1.description: A prescription has been issued for the medication.

at0.9.1.description: The date that the next vaccination is due.

at0010.0.1.description: A prescription has been re-issued for an existing medication order.

at0011.0.1.description: Issue of the prescription is awaiting re-authorisation by a clinician.

at0015.1.1.description: Administration of the medication has been ceased during the period of the intended course.

at0.1.1.description: The immunisation schedule or protocol applied.
at0.1.1.comment: e.g.  Primary childhood immunisations, Influenza, Covid-19.

at0008.1.1.description: The prescription has not been dispensed due to a technical or pharamaceutical supply issue.

at0151.0.1.description: Prescription has been invalidated or has expired without being fulfilled.

at0.3.1.description: The country where the vaccination was carried out

at0006.1.1.description: A single administration of the medication has taken place.

at0133.0.1.description: The reason or justification for the substitution action taken.
at0133.0.1.comment: For example: "Generic alternative contains a substance that is not tolerated by the patient." May be coded with a terminology when clinically appropriate

at0141.0.1.description: Structured description of the site of administration of the ordered item.
at0141.0.1.comment:
For example: 'left upper arm', 'intravenous catheter right hand'. 
Coding of the body site with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

at0005.1.1.description: The individual medication has been reassessed, for example whether the medication should still be taken. This is not intended to capture review of the medication list.

at0150.0.1.description: The prescription was cancelled prior to being issued.

at0140.0.1.description: Details of body site and administration of the medication.

at0039.0.1.description: A major change to the order was required, resulting in this order being stopped and a replacement order being started.

at0106.0.1.description: The original medication order has been re-authorised to allow repeat prescription or dispensing. In some jurisdictions an entirely new order must be issued in these circumstances.

at0004.1.1.description: The medication has been taken by, or administered to, the patient for the first time. Although in some settings this significant date may be computable as the first of several administrations, in other settings, such as primary care, specific administration dates are not readily available.

at0149.0.1.description: The pathway step has been checked by a separate individual.
at0149.0.1.comment: Details of the individual performing the double-check can be carried in the Reference Model element "Participation".

at0043.0.1.description: The datetime at which the medication action was scheduled to occur.
at0043.0.1.comment: Used to compare variance from actual action time where this is not readily calculable from the original instruction.

at0152.0.1.description: The prescription has been fulfilled successfully.

at0016.1.1.description: The time to start the medication, or other starting condition, has been set.

at0000.1.1.description: Detaljer om enhver legemiddelrelatert oppgave som utfres fra et legemiddel er ordinert eller rekvirert til det er utdelt eller eventuelt kassert, for eksempel bestilling, istandgjring, administrering, ekspedering eller seponering.
at0000.1.1.comment: Dette er ikke begrenset til aktiviteter utfrt p bagrunn av legemiddelordineringer fra klinikere, men kan ogs omfatte  ta legemidler som ikke er reseptpliktige.

at0000.1.description: Detaljer om enhver legemiddelrelatert oppgave som utfres fra et legemiddel er ordinert eller rekvirert til det er utdelt eller eventuelt kassert, for eksempel bestilling, istandgjring, administrering, ekspedering eller seponering.
at0000.1.comment: Dette er ikke begrenset til aktiviteter utfrt p bagrunn av legemiddelordineringer fra klinikere, men kan ogs omfatte  ta legemidler som ikke er reseptpliktige.

at0012.1.description: Den planlagte medisineringen er avbrutt fr den frste dosen er administrert.

at0016.1.description: Tidspunktet eller vilkr for  starte medisineringen er satt.

at0148.1.description: Legemiddelet er fysisk istandgjort, for eksempel istandgjring av en intravens blanding.

at0005.1.description: Legemiddelet er revurdert, for eksempel for hvorvidt det fortsatt skal tas. Dette er ikke ment  omfatte gjennomgang av en legemiddelliste.

at0004.1.description: Legemiddelet er inntatt av eller administrert til pasienten for frste gang. Selv om dette i noen bruksomrder som f.eks. sykehus kan utledes fra den frste av en rekke administreringer, m det i andre bruksomrder som f.eks. allmennpraksis spesifiseres spesifikt siden administreringer ikke dokumenteres p samme mte.

at0008.1.description: Legemiddelet er ikke utdelt fordi det ikke er p lager enda.

at0015.1.description: Legemiddelet er seponert etter at frste dose er administrert, men fr planlagt fullfrelse av ordineringen.

at0020.1.description: Navnet p legemiddelet, vaksinen eller det medisinske forbruksmateriellet som var fokus for aktiviteten.
at0020.1.comment: For eksempel: 'Atenolol 100mg' eller 'Tenormin 100mg tabletter'. Det anbefales sterkt at "Legemiddel" kodes med en terminologi som understtter beslutningssttte der dette er mulig, f.eks. FEST. Niv av koding kan variere fra legemiddelnavn til strukturerte detaljer om den aktuelle legemiddelforpakningen som skal brukes. Fritekst br bare brukes om ingen passende terminologi er tilgjengelig.

at0025.1.description: Sekvensnummeret for den spesifikke handlingen som blir registrert.

at0006.1.description: En enkelt administrering av legemiddelet er utfrt.

at0018.1.description: En enkeltdose er holdt tilbake og ikke administrert ("nullet"). Det er ingen forventing om at den aktuelle dosen skal gis p et senere tidspunkt, men neste dose administreres i henhold til ordineringen.

at0044.1.description: Administrering av legemiddelet er utsatt/forsinket, men legemiddelet forventes administrert s raskt som mulig.

at0000.description: Detaljer om enhver legemiddelrelatert oppgave som utfres fra et legemiddel er ordinert eller rekvirert til det er utdelt eller eventuelt kassert, for eksempel bestilling, istandgjring, administrering, ekspedering eller seponering.
at0000.comment: Dette er ikke begrenset til aktiviteter utfrt p bagrunn av legemiddelordineringer fra klinikere, men kan ogs omfatte  ta legemidler som ikke er reseptpliktige.

at0002.description: Det er utstedt en resept for legemiddelet.

at0003.description: Legemiddelet er utdelt, for eksempel fra et apotek til pasienten.

at0004.description: Legemiddelet er inntatt av eller administrert til pasienten for frste gang. at0006.description: En enkelt administrering av legemiddelet er utfrt.

at0008.description: Legemiddelet er ikke utdelt fordi det ikke er p lager enda.

at0009.description: Administrering av legemiddelet er satt p vent inntil videre, ordinasjonen er "nullet". Ingen ytterligere doser gis fr kriterium eller dato for  sette medisineringen i gang igjen er mtt. Nr dato eller kriterium for  ny oppstart settes, br det gjres et 'suspend_step' tilbake til "Oppstartsdato satt".

at0010.description: Legemiddelet har ftt en fornyet resept for den eksisterende ordineringen.

at0011.text: Reautorisering av resept satt p vent
at0011.description: Utstedelse av resept avventer reautorisering av en kliniker. I noen myndighetsomrder kan ikke resepter reautoriseres, og det m i disse tilfellene utstedes en helt ny resept.

at0012.description: Den planlagte medisineringen er avbrutt fr den frste dosen er administrert.

at0013.description: Den planlagte medisineringen er satt p vent fr den frste dosen er administrert.

at0015.description: Legemiddelet er seponert etter at frste dose er administrert, men fr planlagt fullfrelse av ordineringen.

at0016.description: Tidspunktet eller vilkr for  starte medisineringen er satt.

at0018.description: En enkeltdose er holdt tilbake og ikke administrert ("nullet"). Det er ingen forventing om at den aktuelle dosen skal gis p et senere tidspunkt, men neste dose administreres i henhold til ordineringen.

at0020.description: Navnet p legemiddelet, vaksinen eller det medisinske forbruksmateriellet som var fokus for aktiviteten.
at0020.comment: For eksempel: 'Atenolol 100mg' eller 'Tenormin 100mg tabletter'. Det anbefales sterkt at "Legemiddel" kodes med en terminologi som understtter beslutningssttte der dette er mulig, f.eks. FEST. Niv av koding kan variere fra legemiddelnavn til strukturerte detaljer om den aktuelle legemiddelforpakningen som skal brukes. Fritekst br bare brukes om ingen passende terminologi er tilgjengelig.

at0021.description: rsak til at det aktuelle prosesstrinnet ble utfrt.
at0021.comment: For eksempel: Dersom administrering er utsatt pga pasienten ikke er tilgjengelig, velges prosesstrinnet "Utsatt administrering", og "Pasienten er ikke tilgjengelig ved administreringstidspunktet" dokumenteres i dette elementet. Dersom legemiddelet seponeres pga legemiddelreaksjon, velges prosesstrinnet "Seponert", og "Legemiddelreaksjon" dokumenteres i dette elementet. NB: Dette er ikke rsaken til legemiddelordineringen, men de spesifikke rsakene til at det aktuelle prosesstrinnet ble utfrt. Dette vil som regel brukes for  dokumentere varians fra den opprinnelige ordineringen.

at0024.description: Ytterligere fritekstdetaljer om aktiviteten eller prosesstrinnet som ikke representeres i andre elementer, inkludert detaljer om varians mellom den planlagte handlingen og handlingen som faktisk ble utfrt.
at0024.comment: For eksempel "Pasienten var p rntgenavdelingen" eller "Utilsiktet intravens injeksjon under intramuskulr administrering".

at0025.description: Sekvensnummeret for den spesifikke handlingen som blir registrert.

at0033.description: Enhver instruksjon som gis til pasienten eller en omsorgsperson nr prosesstrinnet utfres.
at0033.comment: For eksempel "unng grapefrukt", "ta minst 2 timer fr sengetid" eller "ta med mat". Kan kodes med en terminologi der det er klinisk passende.

at0039.description: Det er utfrt en strre endring i ordineringen, denne ordineringen er stoppet og en ny ordinering er igangsatt.

at0041.description: Legemiddelordineringen er endret p en slik mte at det etter lokale retningslinjer ikke er behov for en ny ordinering. For eksempel endring av produkt fra tabletter til kapsler.

at0043.description: Dato/tid for nr legemiddelaktiviteten var planlagt  skulle skje.
at0043.comment: Brukes til  sammenligne varians fra faktisk tidspunkt for en aktivitet, der dette ikke er mulig  beregne ut fra den opprinnelige ordineringen.

at0044.description: Administrering av legemiddelet er utsatt/forsinket, men legemiddelet forventes administrert s raskt som mulig.

at0053.description: Ytterligere strukturerte detaljer om handlingen, for eksempel spesifikk informasjon for det aktuelle prosesstrinnet.

at0085.description: Ytterligere informasjon som er ndvendig for  sammenstille med andre referansemodeller/formalismer.
at0085.comment: F.eks. lokale informasjonskrav eller ekstra metadata for  samsvare med FHIR eller CIMI ekvivalenter.

at0103.comment: Dette dataelementet tillater flere forekomster som kan defineres mer eksplisitt ved behov.

at0104.description: Strukturerte detaljer om legemiddelet, blant annet styrke, form og virkestoffene det bestr av.
at0104.comment: Bruk dette SLOTet til  spesifisere en detaljert beskrivelse av det bestilte, istandgjorte, administrerte, ekspederte eller seponerte produktet. For eksempel form, styrke, fortynningsmiddel eller blandinger av ingredienser.

at0106.description: En repeterende resept har blitt reautorisert. I noen myndighetsomrder m det i disse tilfellene utstedes en helt ny resept.

at0109.description: Medisineringen er anbefalt, men ordinering er ikke iverksatt.

at0131.comment: Arketypen CLUSTER.dosage er ment  inneholde detaljer om endringer i legemiddelordinering eller i administrert dose, mens CLUSTER.medication_supply_amount er ment for detaljer rundt ekspedering.

at0132.description: Generisk bytte utfrt ved administrering eller ekspedering.
at0132.comment: I mange myndighetsomrder er generisk bytte av et ordinert produkt mot et bioekvivalent produkt fra en annen produsent tillatt. I andre omrder er bytte forutsatt, og ordinerende kliniker m eksplisitt avsl bytte.

at0133.description: rsak eller begrunnelse for at generisk bytte er utfrt eller ikke utfrt.
at0133.comment: For eksempel "Generiske alternativer inneholder et hjelpestoff som ikke tolereres av pasienten". Kan kodes med en terminologi der det er klinisk passende.

at0138.description: Det ordinerte produktet ble byttet til et bioekvivalent produkt.

at0139.description: Det ordinerte produktet ble ikke byttet til et bioekvivalent produkt, til tross for at dette var tillatt i ordineringen.

at0141.description: Strukturert beskrivelse av hvor i kroppen det ordinerte produktet skal administreres eller ble administrert.
at0141.comment: For eksempel "venstre overarm", "intravenst kateter hyre hnd". Det br om mulig benyttes terminologi, f.eks. SNOMED CT eller EDQM standardtermer, for  kode anatomisk lokalisering.

at0142.description: Strukturert beskrivelse av administreringsstedet for legemiddelet eller vaksinen.
at0142.comment: For eksempel "p hudoverflaten medialt p venstre underarm, fra 10 cm til 20 cm distalt fra albuspissen".

at0143.description: Metoden legemiddelet ble administrert eller skal administreres ved.
at0143.comment: For eksempel "via Z-trackinjeksjon", "via forstver". Koding av administreringsmetoden med en terminologi er anbefalt, der det er mulig.

at0144.description: Detaljer om utstyret som ble brukt for  administrere legemiddelet.

at0145.description: Det er forberedt et utkast for en resept, og denne avventer godkjenning av en autorisert kliniker. Kan brukes der reseptutstedelse utfres satsvis. Dette prosesstrinnet kan brukes enten med status "planned" eller "active", for  underbygge behovet for  hndtere bde nye og reautoriserte ordinasjoner.

at0147.description: Administreringsveien som skal eller ble brukt for legemiddelet.
at0147.comment: For eksempel "oral bruk", "intravenst" eller "p huden". Det br om mulig benyttes terminologi, f.eks. FEST, for  angi administreringsvei. Det kan spesifiseres flere mulige administreringsveier.

at0148.description: Legemiddelet er fysisk istandgjort, for eksempel istandgjring av en intravens blanding.

at0149.description: Prosesstrinnet har blitt kontrollert av en annen person enn den som primrt utfrer det.

at0150.description: Resepten ble avbrutt fr den ble utstedt.

at0141.0.1.comment: For eksempel "venstre overarm", "intravenst kateter hyre hnd". Det br om mulig benyttes terminologi, f.eks. SNOMED CT eller EDQM standardtermer, for  kode anatomisk lokalisering.

at0020.1.1.description: Navnet p legemiddelet, vaksinen eller det medisinske forbruksmateriellet som var fokus for aktiviteten.
at0020.1.1.comment: For eksempel: 'Atenolol 100mg' eller 'Tenormin 100mg tabletter'. at0148.1.description: Das Arzneimittel wurde zubereitet. Zum Beispiel: Zubereitung einer intravensen Mischung.

at0005.1.description: Das individuelle Arzneimittel wurde neu bewertet, beispielsweise ob das Arzneimittel noch angewendet werden soll. Eine berprfung der Arzneimittelliste soll nicht durchgefhrt werden.

at0004.1.description: Das Arzneimittel wurde zum ersten Mal von dem Patienten eingenommen oder verabreicht. Obwohl in einigen Situation die erste von mehreren Anwendungen errechenbar ist, kann es in der Primrversorgung sein, dass genaue Verabreichungsdaten nicht ohne weiteres verfgbar sind.

at0008.1.description: Das Rezept wurde aufgrund einer technischen oder pharmazeutischen Strung nicht ausgegeben.

at0015.1.description: Die Verabreichung des Arzneimittels wurde whrend der Dauer der geplanten Behandlung eingestellt.

at0007.1.description: Die medikamentse Behandlung wurde, wie geplant, beendet.

at0020.1.description: Name des Arzneimittels, eines Impfstoffs oder eines anderen therapeutischen Mittels, welches im Mittelpunkt der Aktivitt steht.
at0020.1.comment:
Zum Beispiel: "Atenolol 100 mg" oder "Tenormin Tabletten 100 mg".
Es wird dringend empfohlen, dass das Element "Arzneimittel" mit einer Terminologie kodiert wird, die nach Mglichkeit eine Entscheidungsuntersttzung auslsen kann. Der Umfang der Kodierung kann vom einfachen Namen des Arzneimittels bis hin zu strukturierten Details ber die tatschlich verwendete Medikamentenpackung variieren. Die Freitext-Eingabe sollte nur dann verwendet werden, wenn keine entsprechende Terminologie vorhanden ist.

at0025.1.description: Die Sequenznummer des Prozessschritts wird erfasst.

at0006.1.description: Eine einzelne Verabreichung des Arzneimittels ist erfolgt.

at0018.1.description: Eine Gabe des Arzneimittels wurde zurckgehalten und nicht gegeben. Es besteht keine Erwartung, dass sie spter verabreicht wird, obwohl die nchste Dosis (falls es eine gibt) gem der ursprnglichen Verordnung verabreicht werden sollte.

at0044.1.description: Die Verabreichung einer Dosis hat sich verzgert, wird aber so schnell wie mglich erfolgen.

at0000.description: Jede Aktivitt in Bezug auf die Planung, Vorbereitung, Rezeptverwaltung, Ausgabe, Verabreichung, Einnahme, Absetzung und anderer Verwendung von Arzneimitteln, Impfstoffen, Nahrungsergnzungsmitteln und anderen therapeutischen Mitteln.
at0000.comment: Dies beschrnkt sich nicht nur auf Aktivitten, die auf der Grundlage von Arzneimittelverordnungen von rzten durchgefhrt werden, sondern kann sich auch z.B. auf die Einnahme von freiverkuflichen Medikamenten beziehen.

at0002.description: Fr das Arzneimittel wurde ein Rezept ausgestellt.

at0003.description: Das verordnete Arzneimittel ist an einen Patienten ausgegeben worden, z.B. von einer Apotheke.

at0004.description: Das Arzneimittel wurde zum ersten Mal von dem Patienten eingenommen oder verabreicht. Obwohl in einigen Situation die erste von mehreren Anwendungen errechenbar ist, kann es in der Primrversorgung sein, dass genaue Verabreichungsdaten nicht ohne weiteres verfgbar sind.

at0005.description: Das individuelle Arzneimittel wurde neu bewertet, beispielsweise ob das Arzneimittel noch angewendet werden soll. Eine berprfung der Arzneimittelliste soll nicht durchgefhrt werden.

at0006.description: Eine einzelne Verabreichung des Arzneimittels ist erfolgt.

at0007.description: Die medikamentse Behandlung wurde, wie geplant, beendet.

at0008.description: Das Rezept wurde aufgrund einer technischen oder pharmazeutischen Strung nicht ausgegeben.

at0009.description: Die Verabreichung des Arzneimittels wurde bis zum Erhalt weiterer Informationen ausgesetzt. Es sollten keine weiteren Dosen, bis zur Bekanntgabe des neuen Startdatums oder bis die Bedingungen erfllt sind, verabreicht werden. Wenn Sie das Datum/Bedingungen fr den Neustart nach dem Aussetzen festlegen, sollte ein "suspend_step" von der ausgesetzten Gabe und zurck erfolgen.

at0010.description: Ein Rezept wurde fr eine vorhandene Arzneimittelverordnung neu ausgestellt.

at0011.description: Die Ausstellung des Rezeptes wartet auf die erneute Re-Autorisierung durch einen Arzt.

at0012.description: Die geplante Arzneimittelbehanlung wurde vor der Verabreichung abgesagt.

at0013.description: Die geplante Medikamentenbehanlung wurde vor der Verabreichung verschoben.

at0015.description: Die Verabreichung des Arzneimittels wurde whrend der Dauer der geplanten Behandlung eingestellt.

at0016.description: Das Startdatum der Arzneimittelanwendung oder andere Startbedingungen wurden festgelegt.

at0018.description: Eine Gabe des Arzneimittels wurde zurckgehalten und nicht gegeben. Es besteht keine Erwartung, dass sie spter verabreicht wird, obwohl die nchste Dosis (falls es eine gibt) gem der ursprnglichen Verordnung verabreicht werden sollte.

at0020.description: Name des Arzneimittels, eines Impfstoffs oder eines anderen therapeutischen Mittels, welches im Mittelpunkt der Aktivitt steht.
at0020.comment:
Zum Beispiel: "Atenolol 100 mg" oder "Tenormin Tabletten 100 mg".
Es wird dringend empfohlen, dass das Element "Arzneimittel" mit einer Terminologie kodiert wird, die nach Mglichkeit eine Entscheidungsuntersttzung auslsen kann. Der Umfang der Kodierung kann vom einfachen Namen des Arzneimittels bis hin zu strukturierten Details ber die tatschlich verwendete Medikamentenpackung variieren. Die Freitext-Eingabe sollte nur dann verwendet werden, wenn keine entsprechende Terminologie vorhanden ist.

at0021.description: Begrndung, warum der Prozessschritt fr das identifizierte Arzneimittel durchgefhrt wurde.
at0021.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Verschoben - Patient war zum Zeitpunkt der Arzneimittelgabe nicht verfgbar", "abgesagt - Nebenwirkung". Merke: Dies ist nicht der Grund fr die Arzneimittelverordnung, sondern der spezifische Grund, warum ein Behandlungsschritt durchgefhrt wurde. Wird oft verwendet, um Abweichungen von der ursprnglichen Verordnung zu dokumentieren.

at0024.description: Zur Dokumentation von zustzlichen Schilderungen ber die Aktivitten innerhalb der Prozessschritte, wenn sie noch nicht in anderen Feldern erfasst wurden. Dabei sollen jegliche Abweichungen zwischen durchzufhrender Aktion und tatschlich durchgefhrter Aktion erfasst werden.
at0024.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Patient war in der Radiologie.", "Versehentliche Punktion der Vene whrend der i.m. Gabe."

at0025.description: Die Sequenznummer des Prozessschritts wird erfasst.

at0033.description: Jede Anweisung, Anleitung oder Empfehlung, die dem Patienten oder der Pflegekraft zum Zeitpunkt eines Prozessschrittes bermittelt wird.
at0033.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Vermeiden Sie den Konsum von Grapefruits oder grapefruithaltigen Lebensmitteln.", "Die Einnahme sollte mindestens 2 Stunden vor dem Zubettgehen erfolgen.", "Bitte zusammen mit Nahrung einnehmen." Wenn es klinisch zutreffend ist, kann fr dieses Item eine Terminologie hinterlegt werden.

at0039.description: Eine groe nderung der Verordnung war erforderlich, die dazu fhrte, dass diese Verordnung gestoppt und ein neue Verordnung ausgestellt wurde.

at0041.description: Die Arzneimittelverordnung wurde so gendert, dass keine neue Verordnung/neues Rezept nach den lokalen klinischen Regeln ausgestellt werden muss.

at0043.description: Das Datum/die Uhrzeit, an dem die Arzneimittelgabe eingeplant war.
at0043.comment: Wird verwendet, um die Abweichung von der tatschlichen Anwendungszeit zu vergleichen, wenn diese aus der ursprnglichen Anweisung nicht leicht berechenbar ist.

at0044.description: Die Verabreichung einer Dosis hat sich verzgert, wird aber so schnell wie mglich erfolgen.

at0053.description: Weitere strukturierte Details zu einer Aktivitt, mglicherweise speziell zu einem Prozessschritt.

at0085.description: Zustzliche Informationen zur Erfassung lokaler Inhalte oder Anpassung an andere Referenzmodelle/Formalismen.
at0085.comment: Zum Beispiel: Lokaler Informationsbedarf oder zustzliche Metadaten zur Anpassung an FHIR-Ressourcen oder CIMI-Modelle.

at0103.comment: Kommentar: Dieses Datenelement ermglicht whrend der Laufzeit eine genauere Spezifikation von mehrfach auftretenden Datenelemente, wenn notwendig.

at0104.description: Strukturierte Details ber das Arzneimittel inklusive Strke, Form und Inhaltsstoffe.
at0104.comment: Verwenden Sie diesen SLOT, wenn die detaillierte Beschreibung des ausgegebenen, autorisierten oder verabreichten Arzneimittels ausdrcklich angegeben werden muss. Zum Beispiel: die Form, Strke, alle Verdnner oder Mischung von Inhaltsstoffen.

at0106.description: Die ursprngliche Arzneimittelverordnung wurde erneut genehmigt, um eine wiederholte Verschreibung oder Abgabe zu ermglichen. In einigen Lndern, wie z.B. Deutschland, muss unter diesen Umstnden ein vllig neues Rezept ausgestellt werden.

at0109.description: Das Arzneimittel wurde empfohlen, aber es wurden keine Schritte unternommen, um die Verschreibung/Verordnung einzuleiten.

at0131.description: Spezifische Details ber die Dosis des Arzneimittels.
at0131.comment: CLUSTER.dosage soll Details zu nderungen der Arzneimittelverordnung oder der Dosisverabreichung enthalten, whrend CLUSTER.medication_supply_amount ist fr Details ber die Dosis der Verabreichung bestimmt.

at0132.description: Substitutionsmanahmen, die von der Person ergriffen werden, die das Medikament verabreicht oder ausgibt.
at0132.comment: In vielen Rechtssystemen ist die Substitution eines verordneten Arzneimittels in generischer Form oder mit einem anderen Markennamen, welcher als bioquivalent bestimmt wurde, zum Zeitpunkt der Ausgabe oder Verabreichung erlaubt. In anderen Fllen wird eine Substitution erwartet und der Arzt muss ausdrcklich die Nicht-Substitution verlangen.

at0133.description: Die Ursache oder die Begrndung fr die durchgefhrte Substitution.
at0133.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Generische Alternative beinhaltet eine Substanz, die vom Patient nicht vertragen wird." Kann bei klinischer Eignung mit einer Terminologie kodiert werden.

at0138.description: Ein Arzneimittel wurde substituiert, welches bioquivalent zu dem Angeforderten ist.

at0139.description: Obwohl es nach der Arzneimittelverordnung erlaubt gewesen wre, wurde nicht mit einem bioquivalenten Arzneimittel substituiert.

at0140.description: Details ber die Krperstelle und ber die Verabreichung des Arzneimittels.

at0141.description: Strukturierte Beschreibung der Krperstelle, an der das Arzneimittel angewendet wird.
at0141.comment: Zum Beispiel: "linker Oberarm", "intravenser Katheter rechte Hand". Die Kodierung der Krperstelle mit einer Terminologie, wenn mglich, wird bevorzugt.

at0142.description: Genaue Beschreibung der Krperstelle, an der das Arzneimittel, der Impfstoff oder ein therapeutisches Produkt angewendet wird.
at0142.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Auf der medialen Hautoberflche des linken Unterarms, 10 cm bis 20 cm distal von der Spitze des Ellbogens entfernt."

at0143.description: Die Technik oder das Gert mit dem das verschriebene Arzneimittel verabreicht wird oder werden soll.
at0143.comment: Kommentar: Zum Beispiel: "via Z-track Injektion"; "via Vernebler". Die Kodierung der Methode mit einer Terminologie, wenn mglich, wird bevorzugt.

at0144.description: Details zu der Vorrichtung mit dem das Arzneimittel verabreicht wird.

at0145.description: Der Rezeptentwurf wurde erstellt und wartet auf die Besttigung durch einen autorisierten Arzt. Kann auch verwendet werden, wenn die Re-autorisierung gebndelt erfolgt. Dieser "careflow_step" hat den Status "geplant" oder "aktiv", was die Notwendigkeit widerspiegelt, sowohl Neuauftrge als auch wieder autorisierte Auftrge zu bearbeiten.

at0147.description: Die Angabe darber, auf welche Art das verordnete Arzneimittel am Krper des Patienten angewendet wird.
at0147.comment: Kommentar: Zum Beispiel: "oral", "intravens" oder "topisch". Die Kodierung des Verabreichungswegs wird bevorzugt, wenn mglich. Mehrere potentielle Anwendungsformen knnen spezifiziert werden.

at0148.description: Das Arzneimittel wurde zubereitet. Zum Beispiel: Zubereitung einer intravensen Mischung.

at0149.description: Der Prozessschritt wurde durch eine unabhngige Person berprft.
at0149.comment: Details zu der Person, die die berprfung vornimmt, knnen in das Referenzmodell "Participations" bertragen werden.

at0150.description: Das Rezept wurde vor der Ausstellung widerrufen.

at0151.description: Das Rezept ist ungltig geworden oder ist abgelaufen, ohne das es eingelst wurde.

at0153.description: Das Arzneimittel ist offiziell zur Anwendung genehmigt.

at0154.description: Das Datum/die Uhrzeit an dem die Arzneimittelbehandlung wieder begonnen wird, gem dem "Verabreichung wurde ausgesetzt"- Schritt.

at0155.description: Das Kriterium, das den Neustart der Arzneimitteleinnahme auslst, gem dem Schritt "Verabreichung wurde ausgesetzt".

nb.purpose: For  registrere mengden legemiddel, vaksine, eller annen terapeutisk vare som skal leveres eller utleveres til pasienten, som del av en autorisering, utlevering eller administrering, bde i legemiddelforordningen og i en pflgende legemiddelhandling.
nb.use: Brukes til  registrere mengden legemiddel, vaksine, eller annen terapeutisk vare som skal leveres eller utleveres til pasienten, som del av en autorisering, utlevering eller administrering, bde i legemiddelforordningen og i en pflgende legemiddelhandling.
nb.misuse: Brukes ikke for  registre en dose eller styrke som del av en anvisning. Disse registreres som en del av arketypene INSTRUCTION.medication_order eller CLUSTER.medication_substance.

pt-br.purpose: Para registrar a quantidade de medicamento, vacina ou outro item teraputico a ser fornecido ao paciente, como parte da autorizao, dispensao ou administrao, tanto no contexto da prescrio original quanto em uma ao subsequente de repetio da prescrio.
pt-br.use: Para registrar a quantidade de medicamento, vacina ou outro item teraputico a ser fornecido ao paciente, como parte da autorizao, dispensao ou administrao, tanto no contexto da prescrio original quanto em uma ao subsequente de repetio da prescrio.
pt-br.misuse: Este arqutipo no deve ser usado para registrar a quantidade da dose, concentrao, forma farmacutica de uma preparao de medicamento. Estes so registrados como parte da INSTRUCTION de medicamentos, ou CLUSTER de Substncias Medicamentosas.

en.purpose: To record the amount of a medication, vaccine or other therapeutic item to be supplied or supplied to the patient, as part of authorisation, dispensing or administration, both in the context of the original medication order and in a subsequent action.
en.use: Use to record the amount of a medication, vaccine or other therapeutic item to be supplied or supplied to the patient, as part of authorisation, dispensing or administration, both in the context of the original medication order and in a subsequent action.
en.misuse: This archetype should not be used to record the original dose amount as part of a dose direction or the strength of a preparation. These are recorded as part of the Medication Order INSTRUCTION, or Medication Substance CLUSTER.
